cluster_relations.rel_desc: New physics is conceived as extending beyond the domain of applicability of general relativity.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the conceptual or theoretical scope of the subject framework extends beyond the domain of applicability of the object framework.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: in regimes where GR breaks down (e.g., singularities)

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Quantum gravity is proposed as a framework that could provide a more complete description of black holes than currently available.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject theoretical framework or new physics could provide a more complete or improved description or explanation of the object phenomenon.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: in regimes where general relativity fails (near singularities)
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ImprovementAspect: more complete than classical general relativity

cluster_relations.rel_desc: New physics frameworks in general are suggested as potentially providing a more complete description of black holes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject theoretical framework or new physics could provide a more complete or improved description or explanation of the object phenomenon.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: where general relativity is inadequate (e.g., singularities)

remarks: Relation added with lower confidence; primarily to capture that new physics is aimed at improving black hole descriptions.
Relation added with lower confidence; primarily to capture that new physics is aimed at improving black hole descriptions.
